titleStmt.title: A missive to His Majesty of Great Britain, King James written divers yeers since by Doctor Carier ; conteining [sic] the motives of his conversion to Catholike religion ; vvith a notable fore-sight of the present distempers both in the church and state of His Majesties dominions, and his advice for the prevention thereof.
titleStmt.author: Carier, Benjamin, 1566-1614.

titleStmt.title: A missive to His Majesty of Great Britain, King James written divers yeers since by Doctor Carier ; conteining [sic] the motives of his conversion to Catholike religion ; vvith a notable fore-sight of the present distempers both in the church and state of His Majesties dominions, and his advice for the prevention thereof.
titleStmt.author: Carier, Benjamin, 1566-1614.
Strange, N., 17th cent.
James I, King of England, 1566-1625.

notesStmt.note: Imprint reads: First printed at Liege, and novv re-printed at Paris, vvith some marginall notes, and a previous discourse to the like purpose.
Reproduction of original in Bodleian Library.
"The names of some who have lately been ministers or university men in England and Scotland, and are now converted to the Catholike faith": p. [1]-[4].
